info.description: You can use billing plans and subscriptions to create subscriptions that process recurring PayPal payments for physical or digital goods, or services. A plan includes pricing and billing cycle information that defines the amount and frequency of charge for a subscription. You can also define a fixed plan, such as a $5 basic plan or a volume- or graduated-based plan with pricing tiers based on the quantity purchased. For more information, see Subscriptions Overview.
info.title: Subscriptions

definitions.description: The account identifier for a PayPal account.
definitions.name: account_id

properties.description: The account identifier for a PayPal account.
properties.title: PayPal Account Identifier
properties.name: account_id

definitions.description:
The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed. Not portable with common third party and open source. Redundant with core fields.
For example, `address_portable.address_line_1` is usually a combination of `address_details.street_number`, `street_name`, and `street_type`.
definitions.name: address_details
definitions.title: Address Details

properties.description: The street number.
properties.name: street_number

properties.description: The street name. Just `Drury` in `Drury Lane`.
properties.name: street_name

properties.description: The street type. For example, avenue, boulevard, road, or expressway.
properties.name: street_type

properties.description: The delivery service. Post office box, bag number, or post office name.
properties.name: delivery_service

properties.description: A named locations that represents the premise. Usually a building name or number or collection of buildings with a common name or number. For example, Craven House.
properties.name: building_name

properties.description: The first-order entity below a named building or location that represents the sub-premise. Usually a single building within a collection of buildings with a common name. Can be a flat, story, floor, room, or apartment.
properties.name: sub_building

definitions.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).
definitions.name: address_portable
definitions.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)

properties.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.
properties.name: address_line_1

properties.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.
properties.name: address_line_2

properties.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement for Brazil, direction text, such as `next to Walmart`, or a landmark in an Indian address.
properties.name: address_line_3

properties.description:
The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_3` or `sub_locality`. Value is:
  • The postal sorting code for Guernsey and many French territories, such as French Guiana.
  • The fine-grained administrative levels in China.
properties.name: admin_area_4

properties.description:
A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than `admin_area_level_2`. Value is:
  • Brazil. Suburb, bairro, or neighborhood.
  • India. Sub-locality or district. Street name information is not always available but a sub-locality or district can be a very small area.
properties.name: admin_area_3

properties.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.
properties.name: admin_area_2

properties.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.
properties.name: admin_area_1

properties.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).
properties.name: postal_code

properties.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.
properties.name: country_code

properties.description:
The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed. Not portable with common third party and open source. Redundant with core fields.
For example, `address_portable.address_line_1` is usually a combination of `address_details.street_number`, `street_name`, and `street_type`.
properties.title: Address Details
properties.name: address_details

definitions.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).
definitions.name: address_portable
definitions.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)

properties.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.
properties.name: address_line_1

properties.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.
properties.name: address_line_2

properties.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.
properties.name: admin_area_2

properties.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.
properties.name: admin_area_1

properties.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).
properties.name: postal_code

properties.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

definitions.description: The breakdown details for the amount. Includes the gross, tax, fee, and shipping amounts.
definitions.name: amount_with_breakdown
definitions.title: Amount with Breakdown

properties.description: The amount for this transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: gross_amount

properties.description: The item total for the transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: total_item_amount

properties.description: The fee details for the transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: fee_amount

properties.description: The shipping amount for the transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: shipping_amount

properties.description: The tax amount for the transaction.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: tax_amount

properties.description: The net amount that the payee receives for this transaction in their PayPal account. The net amount is computed as gross_amount minus the paypal_fee.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: net_amount

definitions.description: The application context, which customizes the payer experience during the subscription approval process with PayPal.
definitions.name: application_context
definitions.title: Application Context

properties.description: The label that overrides the business name in the PayPal account on the PayPal site.
properties.name: brand_name

properties.description: The BCP 47-formatted locale of pages that the PayPal payment experience shows. PayPal supports a five-character code. For example, `da-DK`, `he-IL`, `id-ID`, `ja-JP`, `no-NO`, `pt-BR`, `ru-RU`, `sv-SE`, `th-TH`, `zh-CN`, `zh-HK`, or `zh-TW`.
properties.name: locale

properties.description: The location from which the shipping address is derived.
properties.name: shipping_preference

properties.description: Configures the label name to `Continue` or `Subscribe Now` for subscription consent experience.
properties.name: user_action

properties.description: The customer and merchant payment preferences. Currently only PAYPAL payment method is supported.
properties.title: Payment Method
properties.name: payment_method

properties.description: The URL where the customer is redirected after the customer approves the payment.
properties.name: return_url

properties.description: The URL where the customer is redirected after the customer cancels the payment.
properties.name: cancel_url

definitions.description: The backup funding instrument to use for payment when the primary instrument fails.
definitions.name: backup_funding_instrument
definitions.title: Backup Funding Instrument

properties.description: The backup card response information.
properties.title: Card Response
properties.name: card

definitions.description: The billing cycle details.
definitions.name: billing_cycle
definitions.title: Billing Cycle

properties.description: The active pricing scheme for this billing cycle. A free trial billing cycle does not require a pricing scheme.
properties.title: Pricing Scheme
properties.name: pricing_scheme

properties.description: The frequency details for this billing cycle.
properties.title: Billing Cycle Frequency
properties.name: frequency

properties.description: The tenure type of the billing cycle. In case of a plan having trial cycle, only 2 trial cycles are allowed per plan.
properties.name: tenure_type

properties.description: The order in which this cycle is to run among other billing cycles. For example, a trial billing cycle has a `sequence` of `1` while a regular billing cycle has a `sequence` of `2`, so that trial cycle runs before the regular cycle.
properties.name: sequence

properties.description: The number of times this billing cycle gets executed. Trial billing cycles can only be executed a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles). Regular billing cycles can be executed infinite times (value of 0 for total_cycles) or a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles).
properties.name: total_cycles

definitions.description: The billing cycle details to override at subscription level. The subscription billing cycle definition has to adhere to the plan billing cycle definition.
definitions.name: billing_cycle_override
definitions.title: Billing Cycle Override

properties.description: The active pricing scheme for this billing cycle. A free trial billing cycle does not require a pricing scheme.
properties.title: Pricing Scheme
properties.name: pricing_scheme

properties.description: The order in which this cycle is to run among other billing cycles. For example, a trial billing cycle has a `sequence` of `1` while a regular billing cycle has a `sequence` of `2`, so that trial cycle runs before the regular cycle.
properties.name: sequence

properties.description: The number of times this billing cycle gets executed. Trial billing cycles can only be executed a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles). Regular billing cycles can be executed infinite times (value of 0 for total_cycles) or a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles).
properties.name: total_cycles

definitions.description: The payment card to use to fund a payment. Can be a credit or debit card.
definitions.name: card
definitions.title: Card

properties.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the card.

properties.description: The card expiration year and month, in [Internet date format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

properties.description: The three- or four-digit security code of the card. Also known as the CVV, CVC, CVN, CVE, or CID.

properties.description: The last digits of the payment card.

properties.description: The card brand or network. Typically used in the response.

definitions.description: The regular and trial execution details for a billing cycle.
definitions.name: cycle_execution
definitions.title: Billing Cycle Execution Details

properties.description: The type of the billing cycle.
properties.name: tenure_type

properties.description: The order in which to run this cycle among other billing cycles.
properties.name: sequence

properties.description: The number of billing cycles that have completed.
properties.name: cycles_completed

properties.description: For a finite billing cycle, cycles_remaining is the number of remaining cycles. For an infinite billing cycle, cycles_remaining is set as 0.
properties.name: cycles_remaining

properties.description: The active pricing scheme version for the billing cycle.
properties.name: current_pricing_scheme_version

properties.description: The number of times this billing cycle gets executed. Trial billing cycles can only be executed a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles). Regular billing cycles can be executed infinite times (value of 0 for total_cycles) or a finite number of times (value between 1 and 999 for total_cycles).
properties.name: total_cycles

definitions.description: The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.
definitions.name: date_no_time

properties.description: The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.
properties.name: date_no_time

definitions.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.
definitions.name: date_time

properties.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.
properties.name: date_time

definitions.description: The year and month, in ISO-8601 `YYYY-MM` date format. See [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
definitions.name: date_year_month

properties.description: The year and month, in ISO-8601 `YYYY-MM` date format. See [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: date_year_month

definitions.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.
definitions.name: email

properties.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.
properties.name: email

definitions.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.
definitions.name: email_address

properties.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.
properties.name: email_address

definitions.description: The error details.
definitions.name: error
definitions.title: Error

properties.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The message that describes the error.
properties.name: message

properties.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.
properties.name: debug_id

properties.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.
properties.name: information_link

properties.description: An array of additional details about the error.
properties.name: details

properties.description: An array of request-related [HATEOAS links](/api/rest/responses/#hateoas-links).
properties.name: links

definitions.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.
definitions.name: error_details
definitions.title: Error Details

properties.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.
properties.name: field

properties.description: The value of the field that caused the error.
properties.name: value

properties.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.
properties.name: location

properties.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.
properties.name: issue

properties.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.
properties.name: description

definitions.description: The details for the failed payment of the subscription.
definitions.name: failed_payment_details
definitions.title: Failed Payment Details

properties.description: The failed payment amount.
properties.title: Money
properties.name: amount

properties.description: The date and time when the failed payment was made, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: time

properties.description: The reason code for the payment failure.
properties.name: reason_code

properties.description: The time when the retry attempt for the failed payment occurs, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).
properties.name: next_payment_retry_time

definitions.description: The frequency of the billing cycle.
definitions.name: frequency
definitions.title: Billing Cycle Frequency

properties.description: The interval at which the subscription is charged or billed.
properties.name: interval_unit

properties.description:
The number of intervals after which a subscriber is billed. For example, if the `interval_unit` is `DAY` with an `interval_count` of `2`, the subscription is billed once every two days. The following table lists the maximum allowed values for the `interval_count` for each `interval_unit`:
Interval unitMaximum interval count
DAY365
WEEK52
MONTH12
YEAR1
properties.name: interval_count

definitions.description: The [language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#section-2) for the language in which to localize the error-related strings, such as messages, issues, and suggested actions. The tag is made up of the [ISO 639-2 language code](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php), the optional [ISO-15924 script tag](https://www.unicode.org/iso15924/codelists.html), and the [ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/).
definitions.name: language

properties.description: The [language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#section-2) for the language in which to localize the error-related strings, such as messages, issues, and suggested actions. The tag is made up of the [ISO 639-2 language code](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php), the optional [ISO-15924 script tag](https://www.unicode.org/iso15924/codelists.html), and the [ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/).
properties.name: language

definitions.description: The details for the last payment of the subscription.
definitions.name: last_payment_details
definitions.title: Last Payment Details

definitions.description: The request-related [HATEOAS link](/api/rest/responses/#hateoas-links) information.
definitions.name: link_description
definitions.title: Link Description

properties.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.
properties.name: href

properties.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).
properties.name: rel

properties.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.
properties.name: method

definitions.description: The unique ID for a customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.
definitions.name: merchant_partner_customer_id

properties.description: The unique ID for a customer in merchant's or partner's system of records.
properties.name: merchant_partner_customer_id

definitions.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due.
definitions.name: money
definitions.title: Money

properties.description: The [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/) that identifies the currency.
properties.name: currency_code

properties.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/docs/integration/direct/rest/currency-codes/).
properties.name: value

definitions.description: The name of the party.
definitions.name: name
definitions.title: Name

properties.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.
properties.name: prefix

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.
properties.name: given_name

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.
properties.name: surname

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.
properties.name: middle_name

properties.description: The suffix for the party's name.
properties.name: suffix

properties.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.
properties.name: alternate_full_name

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.
properties.name: full_name

definitions.description: The JSON patch object to apply partial updates to resources.

definitions.title: Patch

properties.description: The operation.
properties.name: op

properties.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location at which to complete the operation.
properties.name: path

properties.description: The value to apply. The remove operation does not require a value.
properties.title: Patch Value
properties.name: value

properties.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location from which to move the value. Required for the move operation.
properties.name: from

definitions.description: An array of JSON patch objects to apply partial updates to resources.
definitions.name: patch_request

properties.description: An array of JSON patch objects to apply partial updates to resources.
properties.title: Patch Request
properties.name: patch_request

definitions.description: The details for the merchant who receives the funds and fulfills the order. The merchant is also known as the payee.
definitions.name: payee_base
definitions.title: Merchant Base

definitions.description: The customer who approves and pays for the order. The customer is also known as the payer.

properties.description: The birth date of the payer in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

definitions.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).
definitions.name: payer.address_portable
definitions.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)

properties.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, `173 Drury Lane`. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.
properties.name: address_line_1

properties.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.
properties.name: address_line_2

properties.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.
properties.name: admin_area_2

properties.description:
The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. Format for postal delivery. For example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A kanton.
properties.name: admin_area_1

properties.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).
properties.name: postal_code

properties.description:
The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.
properties.name: country_code

definitions.description: The name of the party.
definitions.name: payer.name
definitions.title: Name

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.
properties.name: given_name

properties.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.
properties.name: surname

definitions.description: The customer and merchant payment preferences.
definitions.name: payment_method
definitions.title: Payment Method

properties.description: The customer-selected payment method on the merchant site.
properties.name: payer_selected

properties.description: The merchant-preferred payment methods.
properties.name: payee_preferred

properties.description: NACHA (the regulatory body governing the ACH network) requires that API callers (merchants, partners) obtain the consumers explicit authorization before initiating a transaction. To stay compliant, youll need to make sure that you retain a compliant authorization for each transaction that you originate to the ACH Network using this API. ACH transactions are categorized (using SEC codes) by how you capture authorization from the Receiver (the person whose bank account is being debited or credited). PayPal supports the following SEC codes.
properties.name: standard_entry_class_code

definitions.description: The payment preferences for a subscription.
definitions.name: payment_preferences

properties.description: Indicates whether to automatically bill the outstanding amount in the next billing cycle.
properties.name: auto_bill_outstanding

properties.description: The initial set-up fee for the service.

properties.name: setup_fee

properties.description: The action to take on the subscription if the initial payment for the setup fails.
properties.name: setup_fee_failure_action

properties.description: The maximum number of payment failures before a subscription is suspended. For example, if `payment_failure_threshold` is `2`, the subscription automatically updates to the `SUSPEND` state if two consecutive payments fail.

properties.description: The maximum number of payment failures before a subscription is suspended. For example, if `payment_failure_threshold` is `2`, the subscription automatically updates to the `SUSPEND` state if two consecutive payments fail.
properties.name: payment_failure_threshold

definitions.description: The payment source definition. To be eligible to create subscription using debit or credit card, you will need to sign up here (https://www.paypal.com/bizsignup/entry/product/ppcp). Please note, its available only for non-3DS cards and for merchants in US and AU regions.

properties.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

properties.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).
properties.name: national_number

properties.description: The reason or notes for the status of the subscription.
properties.name: status_change_note

properties.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.
properties.name: status_update_time

definitions.description: The suspend subscription request details.

definitions.title: Suspend Subscription

properties.description: The reason for suspenson of the subscription.
properties.name: reason

definitions.description: The tax ID of the customer. The customer is also known as the payer. Both `tax_id` and `tax_id_type` are required.
definitions.name: tax_info
definitions.title: Tax Information

properties.description: The customer's tax ID. Supported for the PayPal payment method only. Typically, the tax ID is 11 characters long for individuals and 14 characters long for businesses.
properties.name: tax_id

properties.description: The customer's tax ID type. Supported for the PayPal payment method only.
properties.name: tax_id_type

properties.description: The tax percentage on the billing amount.
properties.name: percentage

properties.description: Indicates whether the tax was already included in the billing amount.
properties.name: inclusive
